Job Title: Automation Engineer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Automation Engineer - Remote, USA
About Interviewed AI:Interviewed AI is at the cutting edge of employing artificial intelligence to revolutionize the hiring process. Our AI-driven solutions aim to streamline the recruitment process, making it more efficient, fair, and effective for companies across the globe. As we expand our technological capabilities, we are in search of an Automation Engineer to join our forward-thinking team. This full-time, remote position is available to candidates across the United States, offering flexible working hours between 9-5pm or 10-6pm. Interviewed AI is flexible regarding employment type, offering both contract and regular positions to suit our new team member's preferences.
Your Role:As an Automation Engineer at Interviewed AI, you will be pivotal in designing, developing, and implementing automation solutions to improve our AI-driven platforms. Your expertise will enhance our system's efficiency, reliability, and scalability, directly impacting our mission to innovate the recruitment process. Working closely with our development and product teams, you will identify opportunities for automation within our processes, ensuring our technology remains at the forefront of the industry.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain automated processes, tools, and scripts to increase system efficiency and reduce manual intervention.Work closely with the software development team to integrate automation techniques into our CI/CD pipelines.Design, build, and maintain automation frameworks for testing our AI-driven applications and systems.Identify, evaluate, and implement new technologies and tools to enhance automation capabilities.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand process challenges and propose automation solutions.Ensure the scalability and reliability of automation scripts and tools through thorough documentation and robust testing.
Technical Requirements:Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or C#.Experience with automation and orchestration tools (e.g., Jenkins, Ansible, Puppet, Chef).Familiarity with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and developing in cloud environments.Proficiency in developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).Experience with software testing and building automation frameworks.Strong understanding of system administration and operations in a Linux/Unix environment.Ability to work with version control systems, such as Git.
Experience:3+ years of experience in an automation engineering role or similar.Demonstrated success in automating processes, testing, and deployment in a cloud-based environment.Experience with AI technologies or working on AI-driven projects is highly desirable.
Who You Are:A proactive problem solver passionate about automation and efficiency.Able to work independently in a fully remote setting, managing your time and tasks effectively.An excellent communicator, capable of collaborating with teams across different disciplines.Eager to learn and stay up-to-date with the latest in automation, AI technologies, and cloud computing.Detail-oriented, with a commitment to creating reliable and reusable automation solutions.
Join Us:At Interviewed AI, youâ€™ll be part of a team dedicated to transforming the recruitment industry through innovative AI technology. Enjoy the flexibility of remote work across the US, with standard working hours, and contribute to projects at the forefront of technological advancement. Here, we value the skills and dedication you bring to our mission above all else.
Please note: This position does not require a university degree. We prioritize practical experience, a proven track record in automation, and a passion for technology over formal education.

Experience Level (if available): None
